title: Maximum value of a function defined as an integral

content.question: Let f be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>/</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi aadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabg2da9maa pedapaqaa8qaciGGJbGaai4BaiaacohaaSWdaeaapeGaaGymaiaac+ cacaaIZaaapaqaa8qacaWG4baaniabgUIiYdGcdaqadaWdaeaapeWa aSaaa8aabaWdbiaaigdaa8aabaWdbiaadshapaWaaWbaaSqabeaape GaaGOmaaaaaaaakiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@4AFA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>dt for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. At which of the following values of x does f attain a relative maximum?

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
